intro: Sassia, commonly known as the marshmallow plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. Sassia species are known for their mucilage-rich stems, which have been used traditionally in herbal remedies. These plants play an important role in supporting local biodiversity and are often part of wetland ecosystems.
